summary: This is a 1996 NYPD complaint report documenting an aggravated harassment case. The victim reported that Jeffrey Epstein called her, threatened to burn her paintings, and send her Polaroids of the burnt paintings. Epstein is listed as the wanted suspect, and the report indicates he had keys to the victim's apartment.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffery
persons.context: Listed as the wanted person for aggravated harassment; accused of calling the victim, threatening to burn her paintings, and having keys to her apartment.

persons.name: Limos
persons.context: The female victim (age 26) who reported that Jeffrey Epstein called and threatened to burn her paintings. Her address and phone number are listed in the report.

connections.description: Epstein is the wanted suspect accused of harassing and threatening the victim, Limos. The report states he had keys to her apartment.

events.title: Harassment Threat Reported
events.description: The victim, Limos, reported that Jeffrey Epstein called her and stated he was going to burn her paintings and send her Polaroids of the burnt paintings.

locations: Home address of victim Limos (listed as HOME-PERMANENT)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was listed as a wanted suspect in a 1996 NYPD aggravated harassment complaint (Complaint #1996-006-007241).
The victim reported that Epstein threatened to burn her paintings and send her Polaroids of the burnt paintings.
The report indicates Epstein had keys to the victim's apartment, suggesting a prior personal connection.
The case status is marked as CLOSED, though the clearance details (arrest, etc.) are not filled in.
This document shows an early law enforcement interaction with Epstein dating back to 1996, predating his later federal investigations by over a decade.
